questiontext.text:
Optional zero-mark Parsons Problem warm-up question

Use drag-and-drop to reorder and indent the lines of code below in order to build a function print_products(product_dict). The function takes as a parameter a dictionary that maps from a product ID code (a string) to a tuple containing a product name and a price. The function prints out the products one per line in alphabetical order of product code as shown in the example.

Warning: not all available lines in the "Drag from here" section are needed.

question.answer:
{"CR-parsons-target":["def print_products(product_dict):
 """Print the products in the given dictionary"""
 for code, product in sorted(product_dict.items()):
 name, price = product
 print(f"{code}: {name} (${price:.2f})")
"],"CR-parsons-source":["for code, product in sorted(items(product_dict))
product = name, price
code, product = product_dict.items()
"]}

testcode.text: products = { "SKH01": ("Sky hook", 33.95), "KNB14": ("Knurled knob", 2.35), "STP99": ("Striped paint", 11.00), "PPM09": ("Perpetual motion machine", 999.99) } print_products(products)

expected.text: KNB14: Knurled knob ($2.35) PPM09: Perpetual motion machine ($999.99) SKH01: Sky Hook ($33.95) STP99: Striped paint ($11.00)
